body:
Maybe this should better be done in the standalone project itself?

If the purpose it to slim down dependencies, it would be better to depend only on play-ws-standalone.

You can bind a standalone client very simply, as it's a wrapper around `AsyncHttpClient`, which is exposed:

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/master/framework/src/play-ahc-ws/src/main/scala/play/api/libs/ws/ahc/AhcWSModule.scala#L207

You can also use `wsClient.underlying[AsyncHttpClient]` in a pinch and provide an implicit conversion to `StandaloneWSClient`.  I'm not sure off the top of my head how much overhead is involved, but IIRC it should be just a wrapper and all the threads and caching are baked into AsyncHttpClient, and there's no lifecycle to take care of.

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/master/framework/src/play-ws/src/main/scala/play/api/libs/ws/WSClient.scala#L28

@francisdb, thanks to your comment, I found that the `wsClient`created by play is accessible within a class by using the trait `play.api.libs.ws.ahc.AhcWSComponents`. That's usefull because I try to avoid runtime dependency injection at any cost !

> It would be simpler if the AhcWSComponents would also expose a StandaloneWSClient next to the play WsClient.

I don't see a problem in doing that. Keep in mind we will need changes in both Java and Scala versions of `AhcWSComponents`. For the Java implementation, it could be trickier to avoid creating multiple instances of `StandaloneWSClient` though.

issue.title: Expose StandaloneWSClient method from AhcWSComponents

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

body:
> > It would be simpler if the AhcWSComponents would also expose a StandaloneWSClient next to the play WsClient.
> 
> I don't see a problem in doing that. Keep in mind we will need changes in both Java and Scala versions of `AhcWSComponents`. For the Java implementation, it could be trickier to avoid creating multiple instances of `StandaloneWSClient` though.

@marcospereira @wsargent 
Could you review if I'm doing what was suggested?
